projects.name: The solar system travel guide
projects.text: As a three-member team at the Technigo Web Developer Bootcamp, we created a scalable application with a robust backend and structured API. Using NPM packages and React Hooks, we implemented dynamic features and optimized functionality. Our design prioritizes readability and accessibility through thoughtful color choices and user-focused interactions. The app supports keyboard navigation and includes engaging features to spark curiosity and enhance the user experience.

projects.name: Project Auth
projects.text: A small team project to develop a frontend and backend system for user authentication and authorization, using a login method to securely manage user access.

projects.name: Happy Thoughts API
projects.text: In this project, I used MongoDB to store data and set up Express endpoints to fetch it. I also created POST endpoints that allow users to send data to the API, enabling the application to save new objects directly into the MongoDB database.

projects.name: Happy Thoughts - a Post & Fetch comment feed
projects.text: In this frontend project, I implemented the useEffect hook in React to manage component lifecycles and handle side effects. I worked with an API to fetch and post data, ensuring seamless data interaction. I used Postman to test and validate API endpoints during development.

projects.name: Labyrinth game
projects.text: A maze navigation project, where I built an interface that allows users to navigate a maze through a text-based adventure provided by an API. I used Zustand for global state management to store and manage the data from the API, focusing on integrating the API and handling state across the application.

projects.name: To-Do List
projects.text: A task management app using React with useContext for state management. The app allows users to add tasks and mark them as done, while managing the application state.

projects.name: Design handoff - a collaboration project with a UX designer student
projects.text: Working as a two-member team, we collaborated with a UX designer to implement a design handoff. We transformed her design into a functional, responsive interface using a CSS library to streamline styling and ensure consistency.

projects.name: React Router Movie site
projects.text: A pair project where we built a multi-page site using React Router to fetch a list of movies from an API and display them in the UI. The site allows users to navigate between pages and view movie details dynamically.

projects.name: Weather app
projects.text: This project is a live-updating weather forecast for Stockholm, Sweden. Using JavaScript and data fetched from an API, I implemented a feature to display a five-day weather forecast, with the design dynamically changing to reflect the current weather conditions.

projects.name: Chatbot
projects.text: This is a chatbot interface using JavaScript. The chatbot interacts with users by asking questions, displaying messages, and responding accurately.

projects.name: JavaScript Pizzeria
projects.text: A simple interactive page to place a food order, focusing on mastering core JavaScript concepts like variables, conditionals, and native methods.

projects.name: My React Portfolio project
projects.text: This component-based portfolio is built as a web application. The user interface is styled with CSS-in-JS through Styled Components, with scalability and maintainability in mind.
